text: Thallium(I) bromide, also known as thallous bromide, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is TlBr. It has thallium and bromide ions in it. The thallium is in its +1 oxidation state. ==Properties== Thallium(I) bromide is a yellow-white solid. It is similar to silver bromide. It gets darker when light shines on it. It is very toxic, like all thallium compounds. It does not dissolve in water. ==Preparation== Thallium(I) bromide is made by reacting thallium and bromine or by reacting sodium or potassium bromide with any thallium compound. ==Uses== It is used in semiconductors and gamma ray and X-ray detectors. ==Related pages== *Thallium(I) chloride *Sodium bromide *Thallium(I) oxide Category:Thallium compounds Category:Bromine compounds
title: Thallium(I) bromide
